Posts.Content: Hi, I'm new to the site, so I'm not really sure what I'm doing. I am looking for help and would appreciate advice from anyone. I have breast cancer. I have responded really well to treatment and have been told that I do not need a mastectomy. The surgeon has said that he can just remove a small area. The problem is that I am absolutely terrified of needles and he needs to insert a marker in order to be able to remove the area in question. I feel that it has left me with no choice but to have the mastectomy. This is something I really didn't want as I know it will destroy my confidence. I've never had much anyway, but if I lose my breast, I don't feel as though I'll ever be able to face the world again. I know that I should be over the moon with the news he gave me, but my fears have taken that away. Is there any way over overcoming my fears? If anyone has any similar experience of anything like this, I would appreciate your advice. Thanks

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn,             Thank you for responding to my post. I have spoken to the surgeon about it, but he said that the marker has to put in while I am awake because I have to stand up for the mammogram to make sure the wire is in the right place. I have been thinking about sedatives, but they're going to have to be quite strong because it's instinctive for me to run. I really will need to be on another planet. From the reaction I'm getting, I don't think they've come across anyone like me before and they're probably hoping they never do again! Most of the staff are very understanding, but they've made it clear that I have to be conscious.  Thanks again, Kind regards x
